poem:
### The Old Silence

In the vast fields, unspeaking,
blood of men
clings to the silent soil;
steel and flesh commingle,
words are wind,
and the earth absorbs all cries.

Beside the broken tanks,
lament of ages,
rust whispers softly into the night,
the echo of nations
caught in history's grind,
seeking reason in the rubble.
